law.catch_line: Divisions of Department of State -- Duties.

text.section: The Department of State shall be divided into two (2) divisions, each headed by a director appointed by the Secretary of State pursuant to KRS 12.050.
The Division of Administration shall be responsible for fiscal and personnel matters, elections, public documents, legal affairs and special projects and commissions.

The Division of Business Filings:
Shall be responsible for all functions of the department relating to business filings, including business entity filings and filings under the Uniform Commercial Code; and
May promulgate administrative regulations in accordance with KRS Chapter 13A in furtherance of its responsibilities.

law.history: Amended 2011 Ky. Acts ch. 29, sec. 2, effective June 8, 2011. -- Created 1982 Ky. Acts ch. 379, sec. 1, effective April 9, 1982.
